Psalms__02.1: Why have the Gentiles raged, and the people devised vain things?
Psalms__02.2: The kings of the earth stood up, and the princes met together, against the Lord and against his Christ.
Psalms__02.3: Let us break their bonds asunder: and let us cast away their yoke from us.
Psalms__02.4: He that dwelleth in heaven shall laugh at them: and the Lord shall deride them.
Psalms__02.5: Then shall he speak to them in his anger, and trouble them in his rage.
Psalms__02.6: But I am appointed king by him over Sion his holy mountain, preaching his commandment.
Psalms__02.7: The Lord hath said to me: Thou art my son, this day have I begotten thee.
Psalms__02.8: Ask of me, and I will give thee the Gentiles for thy inheritance, and the utmost parts of the earth for thy possession.
Psalms__02.9: Thou shalt rule them with a rod of iron, and shalt break them in pieces like a potter's vessel.
Psalms__02.10: And now, O ye kings, understand: receive instruction, you that judge the earth.
Psalms__02.11: Serve ye the Lord with fear: and rejoice unto him with trembling.
Psalms__02.12: Embrace discipline, lest at any time the Lord be angry, and you perish from the just way.
Psalms__02.13: When his wrath shall be kindled in a short time, blessed are all they that trust in him.
